scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to prioritize your time off and asked your colleague to reach out to another person. Later, you meet with [Monica] and [Bob] at a team gathering. [Monica] glances at you with a concerned expression, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you didn't help with the urgent task while you were on leave. [Bob] had to stay late to cover for you. What happened?' You responded by saying it was fair to ask someone else to handle it since you were on leave. The conversation continues. [Bob] sighs and says, 'I understand you're on leave, but couldn't you have at least checked in to see if it was really urgent? It put a lot of pressure on us.' You suggested brainstorming ways to handle such situations better in the future. The conversation shifts slightly as [Monica] looks thoughtful. [Monica] raises an eyebrow, 'So, how do you propose we handle these urgent tasks in the future without burdening anyone unfairly?' You suggested that everyone should be more prepared and not rely on others to cover for them. The conversation continues.
scenes.description: [Bob] frowns and says, 'Preparedness is key, but we still need a practical plan. What if the next urgent task happens while someone else is on leave?'

options.text: We could create a detailed emergency protocol that everyone can follow, even in our absence.
options.analysis: You offer a structured solution, showing good emotional perception, social skills, and motivation.

options.text: Maybe we need better training so everyone feels confident handling emergencies alone.
options.analysis: You suggest enhancing individual capability, showing empathy and a reasonable approach but slightly lesser self-regulation.

options.text: Honestly, if everyone just did their job properly, we wouldn't have these issues.
options.analysis: You emphasize personal responsibility, showing strong self-regulation but less empathy and social skills.
